name: Shay's Irish Chili
author: Meegs
summary: This is a wonderful dish for cold winter days that really fills you up! My mother used to make this for my family, and it quickly became a favorite. This isn't your normal 'hot' chili and it's a great change of pace. It's best when served with buttered saltine crackers. This chili also freezes well.
ingredients: ½ (19 ounce) can light red kidney beans, drained and mashed
1 (15.5 ounce) can dark red kidney beans, drained and rinsed
directions: Heat the oil in a soup pot set over medium heat
Add the ground beef, garlic, and onion
Cook, stirring to crumble the ground beef, until beef is no longer pink
Season with salt, pepper, nutmeg, beef bouillon, and chili powder
Add the sugar, tomatoes, light and dark kidney beans and potatoes
Cover and simmer over medium-low heat for 1 hour, stirring occasionally
